ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Easily use 'Blueprint', the popular 'React' library from Palantir, in your 'Shiny' app. 'Blueprint' provides a rich set of UI components for creating visually appealing applications and is optimized for building complex, data-dense web interfaces. This package provides most components from the underlying library, as well as special wrappers for some components to make it easy to use them in 'R' without writing 'JavaScript' code.

Easily use 'Blueprint', the popular 'React' library from Palantir, in your 'Shiny' app. 'Blueprint' provides a rich set of UI components for creating visually appealing applications and is optimized for building complex, data-dense web interfaces. This package provides most components from the underlying library, as well as special wrappers for some components to make it easy to use them in 'R' without writing 'JavaScript' code.

name: r-shiny.blueprint
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "0.3.0" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-shiny.blueprint
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/shiny.blueprint_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/shiny.blueprint/shiny.blueprint_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: b92dae13388fcb4caf646ebd67050f9860d13522a6f4c54f7764bc62ca4fb6c3

build:
  number: 2
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-checkmate
    - r-htmltools
    - r-shiny
    - r-shiny.react >=0.4.0
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-checkmate
    - r-htmltools
    - r-shiny
    - r-shiny.react >=0.4.0

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('shiny.blueprint')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('shiny.blueprint')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=shiny.blueprint
  license: LGPL-3.0-only
  summary: Easily use 'Blueprint', the popular 'React' library from Palantir, in your 'Shiny' app. 'Blueprint' provides a rich set of UI components for creating visually appealing applications and is optimized for building complex, data-dense web interfaces. This package provides most components from the underlying library,
    as well as special wrappers for some components to make it easy to use them in 'R' without writing 'JavaScript' code.
  license_family: LGPL
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/LGPL-3

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
